title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal during Team USA's Olympic win against Denmark.
After the game, Swayman humorously addressed his mistake, admitting he lost sight of the puck.
The U.S. won despite Swayman's performance, and he may not start again this Olympics.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury could impact the NBA season as the Celtics push for playoffs.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express optimism about Tatum returning to All-Star form after his recovery.
Tatum has increased practice activity and may return soon, boosting Celtics' playoff chances with Jaylen Brown.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for this offseason, targeting multiple free agents at key positions.
Alec Pierce from the Colts is a top wide receiver option for the Patriots, with strong big-play potential.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker is identified as a potential left tackle upgrade, maintaining flexibility in the offensive line.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered, making ESPN the new streaming home for Major League Baseball games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99; non-subscribers can purchase it for $149.99 with a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are automatically renewed, with an offer for a free ESPN Unlimited trial, accessible via ESPN's app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, raising speculation for his return from an Achilles injury.
Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum looked strong during the practice, but his return date remains uncertain.
Despite G League practice, Celtics have not changed Tatum's injury status or provided a timetable for his comeback.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in educational rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card, owned by a Massachusetts-linked family, is being auctioned by Ken Goldin.
The card, ungraded and family-kept for 116 years, is currently priced at $4,758,000 including buyer's premium.
Ken Goldin, host of 'King of Collectibles', connected to Boston through his daughter's schooling and personal baseball experiences.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in his Olympic debut on Saturday.
Swayman, who helped USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, has a season record of 22-12-3.
Connor Hellebuyck will back up Swayman; Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead on a barrier island off Virginia's Eastern Shore.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, following the entangled death of a whale named Division.
The dead whale's mother, Porcia, has lost all three of her calves, highlighting the species' endangered status.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports seven pediatric flu deaths this season, with a total of 260 flu-related deaths statewide.
DPH data shows a recent decline in flu cases, but officials stress the virus's continued presence.
Health officials urge vaccination to prevent flu, especially for children, older adults, and high-risk groups.
